meanings.definition: To outdo in hustling or working hard.
meanings.sent1: She outhustled her classmates in the race by running faster.
meanings.sent2: The team outhustled their opponents to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: Despite being tired, he outhustled everyone in the office with his dedication.
meanings.sent4: The young entrepreneur outhustled the competition with innovative ideas.
meanings.sent5: Her determination to outhustle others made her stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To surpass in energy or effort.
meanings.sent1: The athlete outhustled his previous record by pushing himself harder.
meanings.sent2: She outhustled her teammates by always giving her best effort.
meanings.sent3: Even on a lazy day, he managed to outhustle his own expectations.
meanings.sent4: The student outhustled the rest of the class with his enthusiasm for learning.
meanings.sent5: Their dedication to outhustle each other fueled a friendly competition.

meanings.definition: To outperform in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: The company outhustled its competitors by delivering superior products.
meanings.sent2: He outhustled his opponents in the game with strategic moves.
meanings.sent3: The underdog team outhustled the favorites, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: She outhustled the market by adapting quickly to changing trends.
meanings.sent5: Their teamwork allowed them to outhustle the competition and emerge victorious.
